session_history.content: educate yourself on the table ddls in fitness_db

The fitness_db database contains five tables: Products, SaleDetails, ServiceTickets, Sales, and Customers, each with a defined schema including column names, data types, and primary/foreign key relationships.

Key Observations

  • The Products table stores information about the products sold, including ID, name, type, brand, price, and stock quantity.
  • The SaleDetails table records the details of each sale, linking sales to products and specifying quantity and unit price.
  • The ServiceTickets table tracks customer service requests, including ticket details, customer and product information, issue descriptions, and resolution status.
  • The Sales table contains information about sales transactions, including customer ID, sale date, total amount, and salesperson ID.
  • The Customers table stores customer information such as ID, first name, last name, contact details, address, and registration date.
Collateral Report for: Ad-hoc Query

Data: Result for base_tableList

TableName
Products
SaleDetails
ServiceTickets
Sales
Customers
SQL DDL: fitness_db.Products 
CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Products ,FALLBACK ,
     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,
     NO AFTER JOURNAL,
     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,
     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,
     MAP = TD_MAP1
     (
      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      ProductName VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC NOT NULL,
      ProductType VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Brand VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
      StockQuantity INTEGER)
UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( ProductID );
SQL DDL: fitness_db.SaleDetails 
CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.SaleDetails ,FALLBACK ,
     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,
     NO AFTER JOURNAL,
     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,
     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,
     MAP = TD_MAP1
     (
      SaleDetailID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      SaleID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      Quantity INTEGER NOT NULL,
      UnitPrice DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL, 
FOREIGN KEY ( SaleID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Sales ( SaleID ),
FOREIGN KEY ( ProductID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Products ( ProductID ))
UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( SaleDetailID );
SQL DDL: fitness_db.ServiceTickets 
CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.ServiceTickets ,FALLBACK ,
     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,
     NO AFTER JOURNAL,
     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,
     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,
     MAP = TD_MAP1
     (
      TicketID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      TicketDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD' NOT NULL,
      IssueDescription VARCHAR(1000) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Status VARCHAR(20) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      ResolutionDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD', 
FOREIGN KEY ( CustomerID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Customers ( CustomerID ),
FOREIGN KEY ( ProductID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Products ( ProductID ))
UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( TicketID );
SQL DDL: fitness_db.Sales 
CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Sales ,FALLBACK ,
     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,
     NO AFTER JOURNAL,
     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,
     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,
     MAP = TD_MAP1
     (
      SaleID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      SaleDate TIMESTAMP(6) NOT NULL,
      TotalAmount DECIMAL(12,2) NOT NULL,
      SalesPersonID INTEGER, 
CONSTRAINT pk_sales PRIMARY KEY ( SaleID ), 
FOREIGN KEY ( CustomerID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Customers ( CustomerID ))
;
SQL DDL: fitness_db.Customers 
CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Customers ,FALLBACK ,
     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,
     NO AFTER JOURNAL,
     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,
     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,
     MAP = TD_MAP1
     (
      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,
      FirstName VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      LastName VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Email VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Phone VARCHAR(20) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      Address VARCHAR(255) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      City VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      State VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      ZipCode VARCHAR(10) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,
      RegistrationDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD')
UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( CustomerID );

what are my top 5 customers based on revenue generated?

The top 5 customers based on revenue generated are Mikhail Smirnov, Leo Taylor, Peregrine Took, Genevieve Lefay, and Sofia Mikhailova.

Key Observations

  • Mikhail Smirnov generated the highest revenue with a total of $6999.0.
  • The revenue generated by the top 5 customers ranges from $3499.99 to $6999.0.
  • The analysis calculates total revenue by summing the 'TotalAmount' from the 'Sales' table for each customer.

results.Request Text: CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Products ,FALLBACK ,     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,     NO AFTER JOURNAL,     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,     MAP = TD_MAP1     (      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,      ProductName VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC NOT NULL,      ProductType VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Brand VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Price DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,      StockQuantity INTEGER)UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( ProductID );

CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.SaleDetails ,FALLBACK ,     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,     NO AFTER JOURNAL,     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,     MAP = TD_MAP1     (      SaleDetailID INTEGER NOT NULL,      SaleID INTEGER NOT NULL,      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,      Quantity INTEGER NOT NULL,      UnitPrice DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL, FOREIGN KEY ( SaleID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Sales ( SaleID ),FOREIGN KEY ( ProductID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Products ( ProductID ))UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( SaleDetailID );

CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.ServiceTickets ,FALLBACK ,     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,     NO AFTER JOURNAL,     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,     MAP = TD_MAP1     (      TicketID INTEGER NOT NULL,      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,      ProductID INTEGER NOT NULL,      TicketDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD' NOT NULL,      IssueDescription VARCHAR(1000) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Status VARCHAR(20) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      ResolutionDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD', FOREIGN KEY ( CustomerID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Customers ( CustomerID ),FOREIGN KEY ( ProductID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Products ( ProductID ))UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( TicketID );

CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Sales ,FALLBACK ,     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,     NO AFTER JOURNAL,     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,     MAP = TD_MAP1     (      SaleID INTEGER NOT NULL,      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,      SaleDate TIMESTAMP(6) NOT NULL,      TotalAmount DECIMAL(12,2) NOT NULL,      SalesPersonID INTEGER, CONSTRAINT pk_sales PRIMARY KEY ( SaleID ), FOREIGN KEY ( CustomerID ) REFERENCES fitness_db.Customers ( CustomerID ));

CREATE MULTISET TABLE fitness_db.Customers ,FALLBACK ,     NO BEFORE JOURNAL,     NO AFTER JOURNAL,     CHECKSUM = DEFAULT,     DEFAULT MERGEBLOCKRATIO,     MAP = TD_MAP1     (      CustomerID INTEGER NOT NULL,      FirstName VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      LastName VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Email VARCHAR(100) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Phone VARCHAR(20) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      Address VARCHAR(255) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      City VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      State VARCHAR(50) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      ZipCode VARCHAR(10) CHARACTER SET LATIN NOT CASESPECIFIC,      RegistrationDate DATE FORMAT 'YYYY-MM-DD')UNIQUE PRIMARY INDEX ( CustomerID );

key_observations.text: The Products table stores information about the products sold, including ID, name, type, brand, price, and stock quantity.
The SaleDetails table records the details of each sale, linking sales to products and specifying quantity and unit price.
The ServiceTickets table tracks customer service requests, including ticket details, customer and product information, issue descriptions, and resolution status.
The Sales table contains information about sales transactions, including customer ID, sale date, total amount, and salesperson ID.
The Customers table stores customer information such as ID, first name, last name, contact details, address, and registration date.

workflow_history.user_query: what are my top 5 customers based on revenue generated?

original_plan.goal: Retrieve the top 5 customers based on revenue generated from the fitness_db database.

key_arguments.sql: SELECT TOP 5 c.CustomerID, c.FirstName, c.LastName, SUM(s.TotalAmount) AS TotalRevenue FROM fitness_db.Customers c JOIN fitness_db.Sales s ON c.CustomerID = s.CustomerID GROUP BY c.CustomerID, c.FirstName, c.LastName ORDER BY TotalRevenue DESC;
